bibl.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn. to Crittenden Cregmile, 1862, December 1
bibl.note: 1862 December 1 Southgate Cregmile in Nashville, Tenn., to his brother Crittenden Cregmile. Shares with Crittenden that currently all are well in Nashville and hopes the letter finds him well also. Assures him that as the Rebels continue to scout around the town, they need not worry about taking it, since it is surrounded by fencing and a continuous rifle pit behind that. Aware that they are fortifying at Murfreesboro, General Rosencrans wants them to fortify there so they will make a stand when attacked and won't be running off to Chattanooga because they are unprepared.

div.p: I now set down to rite you a few lines to let you know how we are a getting a longe at Nashvill we are all well at presant and hope these few lines will finde you the same. we have had a good deal of rain here for a few weeks back there has been snow here. it snowed on the 25 of Oct. the rebles are still scouting a rounde Nashville but its no use for them to try to take the town. there are a cresh fense all a round the picket line - and on the in side of that there is a rifel pits. the rebles are a fortifying at murfresboro and Columba Gen Rosecrance sed he wanted them to fortify there so that they will make a stand if he started there nowe they would redoble to Chatanooga we can see the rebles pickets every day from Nashville I hafit to stop riting to night for I cant think of any thing to rite - rite Soon
